quote: A man's dreams are an index to his greatness.
A retentive memory may be a good thing, but the ability to forget is the true token of greatness.
Believe that you possess a basic goodness, which is the foundation for the greatness you can ultimately achieve.
It is not the greatness of a man's means that makes him independent, so much as the smallness of his wants.
To vilify a great man is the readiest way in which a little man can himself attain greatness.
All my life I have always known I was born to greatness.
All your youth you want to have your greatness taken for granted; when you find it taken for granted, you are unnerved.
Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them.
A man's dreams are an index to his greatness.
A retentive memory may be a good thing, but the ability to forget is the true token of greatness.
Believe that you possess a basic goodness, which is the foundation for the greatness you can ultimately achieve.
It is not the greatness of a man's means that makes him independent, so much as the smallness of his wants.
To vilify a great man is the readiest way in which a little man can himself attain greatness.
All my life I have always known I was born to greatness.
All your youth you want to have your greatness taken for granted; when you find it taken for granted, you are unnerved.
Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them.
By constant self-discipline and self-control you can develop greatness of character.
Do not despise the bottom rungs in the ascent to greatness.
Exaggeration is the inseparable companion of greatness.
Greatness and goodness are not means, but ends.
Greatness be nothing unless it be lasting.
Greatness does not approach him who is forever looking down.
Greatness is a spiritual condition.
Greatness knows itself.
Greatness, in order to gain recognition, must all too often consent to ape greatness.
I don't confuse greatness with perfection. To be great anyhow is…the higher achievement.
I never knew a man come to greatness or eminence who lay abed late in the morning.
If any man seeks for greatness, let him forget greatness and ask for truth, and he will find both.
It is the nature of all greatness not to be exact.
It is the sign of a great mind to dislike greatness, and prefer things in measure to things in excess.
It is true greatness to have in one the frailty of a man and the security of a god.
It takes a certain courage and a certain greatness to be truly base.
It's not what you take but what you leave behind that defines greatness.
Man's greatness consists in his ability to do and the proper application of his powers to things needed to be done.
Man's greatness lies in his power of thought.
Many have had their greatness made for them by their enemies.
Mediocrity in politics is not to be despised. Greatness is not needed.
Neither wealth or greatness render us happy.
No man is truly great who is great only in his lifetime. The test of greatness is the page of history.
No might nor greatness in mortality
None, but people of strong passion are capable of rising to greatness.
auther: Honoré Gabriel Riqueti Count of Mirabeau

quote: Nothing is more simple than greatness; indeed, to be simple is to be great.
Of all vices, drinking is the most incompatible with greatness.
Responsibility is the price of greatness.
Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them.
Some have greatness thrust upon them, but not lately.
The abuse of greatness is when it disjoins remorse from power.
The contemporary form of true greatness lies in a civilization founded on the spirituality of work.
The difference between greatness and mediocrity is often how an individual views a mistake...
The essence of greatness is neglect of the self.
The essence of greatness is the perception that virtue is enough.
The greatness of a man's power is the measure of his surrender.
The greatness of a nation can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
The greatness of a nation can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
The greatness of art is not to find what is common but what is unique.
The price of greatness is responsibility.
The truest greatness lies in being kind, the truest wisdom in a happy mind.
There is as much greatness of mind in acknowledging a good turn, as in doing it.
There is no greatness where there is not simplicity, goodness and truth.
Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail. Failure is another steppingstone to greatness.
Those who occupy their minds with small matters, generally become incapable of greatness.
To achieve greatness one should live as if they will never die.
True greatness consists in being great in little things.
When you close your eyes to tragedy, you close your eyes to greatness.
You must remain focused on your journey to greatness.
Be not afraid of greatness; some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them.
